Title: "Innocence Amidst the Echoes"

Children flee the birthplace of stone and steel,
Belgorod, whispers rattle through empty classrooms.
In the trampling of young feet, echoes of a cannon's peal,
Amidst the innocent laughter silenced too soon.
As rag dolls gaze from empty homes in dismay,
Far away, in Lithuania, a leader seeks light within the gray.
O, the singular tune of children at play—will it return someday?
